page.title: 02LICHFIELD CUSTOMS
page.content: Many tourists come to Lichfield to view St.Chad's Cathedral and to see its historic buildings.There are many old traditions and customs that have continued to the present day.The Sheriff's Ride (the ceremony of marking the city's boundaries) takes place in September.St.George's Court (a humorous version of the ancient Court Leet) is held in the Guildhall every 23 April.The Bower Procession (a festival parade of decorated floats)takes place at Whitsuntide.A pancake race is held in Market St. on Shrove Tuesday.In September there is a "Dr. Johnson's Supper" in the Guildhall,when Steak & Kidney pudding,followed by apple tart, is served;speeches are delivered and the men smoke clay 'Churchwarden' pipes.In recent years,there has been an Arts Festival week in July, concluded with a fireworks display.
